name: Mr. Ali Qureshi
presenting_complaint: I've had some discomfort in my chest.
Something’s been bothering me on my left side.
I’m not sure, but my chest feels odd.
I’ve been feeling off — just some weird pressure here.
It’s not painful exactly, just uncomfortable around the chest area.
symptoms: Burning pain localized to the left side of chest
Tingling sensation began before rash appeared
Clustered vesicular rash in a dermatomal pattern

ice.ideas: Maybe it’s a heart attack or muscle pull?
ice.concerns: It’s painful and strange, I’ve never had a rash like this before.
ice.expectations: I want to know if it’s serious and get something for the pain.

examination.gpe: Patient appears uncomfortable, rubbing left chest.
examination.skin_exam: Vesicular rash in left T4 dermatome, crusting in some areas, no discharge.

investigations.ECG: Normal sinus rhythm, no ST/T changes

exam_findings: Dermatomal vesicular rash on the left chest, normal vitals, normal heart and lung exam.
investigation_findings: ECG and troponin normal. Chest X-ray clear.
closure_lines: Thank you doctor, that helps a lot.
Will it go away on its own?
ending_cue: That’s all doctor, thank you for today.

feedback.summary: You recognized a non-cardiac cause of chest pain and explored the rash well.
feedback.improvement: Discuss antiviral treatment options and safety net if worsening.
